definition: broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: Anyone who beats the record will win a season pass for four people for 2007 with VIP queue-jumping status.
sentences.chinese: 破纪录者将能取得2007年四人份优先玩贵宾季卡。

sentences.english: This cluster of record-breaking events could be merely an streak of bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 这一连串破纪录的事件也许只是一连串的霉运。

sentences.english: He did rather well, but he failed to break the record.
sentences.chinese: 他干得不错，可惜没破纪录。

sentences.english: Adversity causes some men to break; others to break records.
sentences.chinese: 困境导致一些人败亡，另一些人破纪录。

sentences.english: Since then, many people have informed Sahar of his record-breaking feats.
sentences.chinese: 现在，许多人都开始期待萨哈破纪录的表现。

sentences.english: Even gold coins are being hoarded as the yellow metal keeps breaking records.
sentences.chinese: 金币收藏市场甚至像黄铜一样持续打破纪录。

sentences.english: At the same time set up a time for the record-breaking team of special incentives.
sentences.chinese: 同时设立了时间奖，为破纪录的队员进行特殊奖励。

sentences.english: Barry Bonds broke the record for career home runs.
sentences.chinese: 邦兹破纪录的职业生涯本垒打。

sentences.english: He ran fast enough to break the record.
sentences.chinese: 他跑的够快而能打破纪录。

sentences.english: In fact, he soon adopted a positively upbeat tone, telling me how I should break the record.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，他很快就用欢快的调子告诉我应去破纪录。

sentences.english: Anyone who beats the record will win a season pass for four people for 2007 with VIP queue-jumping status.
sentences.chinese: 破纪录者将能获得2007年四人份优先玩贵宾季卡。

sentences.english: Today it is at a record low.
sentences.chinese: 现在对国会的信仰处于破纪录的低。

sentences.english: This past year was a record-breaking season for skyscraper construction.
sentences.chinese: 过去的这一年对于摩天大楼来说是个破纪录的时期。

sentences.english: Time for the headliner of the Athens games to play superman all over.
sentences.chinese: 雅典奥运会上破纪录者将勇创新高的时刻。

sentences.english: Consumer investment in dog breeding has been at record-breaking levels in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 消费者投资养狗一直在破纪录的水平，在近几年。

sentences.english: We were able to provide the data in record time to University Hospital Muenster.
sentences.chinese: 我们破纪录地迅速为明斯特大学医院提供了数据。

definition: variant of 記錄|记录[ji4 lu4] (but in Taiwan, not for the verb sense "to record")
strategic pass/barrier or mark (i.e. a level considered impressive, usually a round figure such as 10,000)/instrument of torture used to break limbs
to renovate/to refurbish/to refresh (computer window)/to write a new page (in history)/to break (a record)
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
